CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 6, 1957, pg. 1 reads: "2,000 at Opening Night - A jam-packed crowd of 2,000 persons attended the opening night of The Courier Home Service Fair at Syria Mosque, Tuesday night. Here is shown part of the throng flocked around the New Diamond market booth to receive jars of spaghetti given away by manager Charles Glick to the first 300 women to visit his booth.  The fair, one of the best ever presented in Pittsburgh, will close tonight (Thursday, March 21).  It will  be the biggest prize night of the fair and another capacity crowd is expected. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Crowd of men, and women, including one seated in front wearing dark hat with feathers, gathered in Syria Mosque for the 1957 Courier Home Service Fair
